home_p_14: Noam Med-Defense is a leading company in medical device regulation and instrumentation, specializing in NPI processes and supporting medical device companies throughout the entire product lifecycle. We provide professional and customized solutions for each client, with deep understanding of the regulatory and technical challenges in the industry.
home_p_15: Medical device NPI expert with years of experience leading complex projects. We guide your company from concept to market, ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements.
home_p_16: Specializing in obtaining regulatory approvals for design changes in medical devices. We navigate the complex requirements of the FDA, CE, and other regulators.
home_p_17: Expert in development to production transfer in medical device systems, ensuring smooth and efficient transition. The process includes detailed planning and comprehensive validation.
home_p_18: Leading implementation of PLM systems for documentation and change management tailored to medical device companies' needs. We ensure full integration with existing processes.
home_p_19: Proven track record of success in obtaining regulatory approvals and launching new products. We are committed to results.

about_h1_1: About Noam Med-Defense  Your  Medical Device Expert
about_h2_2: 30 Years of Experience, Proven Expertise, and Commitment to Client Success
about_h2_3: Our Story - From Vision to Reality
about_h2_7: Want to Learn More About Our Team and Approach?
about_p_18: Noam Med-Defense was founded from a deep understanding of the challenges medical device companies face on their path to launching new products and obtaining regulatory approvals. As an NPI expert in medical devices, we have seen firsthand how many companies encounter difficulties in managing complex processes, meeting changing regulatory requirements, and efficiently transitioning from development to manufacturing.
about_p_19:
Our vision was clear from the beginning: to create an engineering support and consulting company that would be a true partner to its clients, deeply understand the unique challenges of each project, and provide practical and effective solutions. 
Transition from development to manufacturing, changes to existing products, and product stabilization under regulatory and business pressure.
Connection between engineering, quality and regulation,

In-depth product involvement, while making Risk-Based  decisions for process and production line improvement until actual stabilization. I accompany medical device companies precisely at the points where things tend to get stuck:
And actually connect between Engineering, QA, RA and manufacturing not at the presentation level, but at the BOM, drawing and production line level.
about_p_20: Aspiration for excellence in every aspect of work. Many years of experience in the medical device industry and regulation. Constant investment in training and updating our knowledge.
about_p_21: We see our clients as partners on the journey, not just projects. Your success is our success, and your challenges are our challenges. We are committed to working together with you throughout the entire process until achieving the goals.
about_p_22: The medical device industry is constantly evolving, and regulatory requirements are changing. We believe in an innovative and creative approach to problem solving, and use the most advanced technologies and working methods.
about_p_23: We believe in transparent and reliable work. We commit to communicating clearly and transparently with our clients, meeting schedules, and delivering the promised services at the highest level.
about_p_24: As an NPI expert in medical devices and an expert in design transfer from development to manufacturing in medical device systems, covering the entire spectrum of medical device development, regulation and manufacturing processes. Broad specialization across a wide range of device types and markets.
about_p_25: We work with a wide range of medical devices - active and passive devices, in-vitro diagnostic devices, implantable devices, digital devices and general medical equipment. Each type of device has unique regulatory requirements, and we know them in depth.
about_p_26: We specialize in working with leading health authorities worldwide - FDA (United States), CE (Europe), Health Canada and others. We know the specific requirements of each authority and the required processes.
about_p_27: We are proficient in all standards and regulations relevant to the medical device industry, including ISO 13485, ISO 14971 (Risk Management), 21 CFR Part 820 (QSR), MDR (European Medical Device Regulations), and more.
about_p_28: Accompanying companies through all development phases: from initial concept, through concept development, prototype, clinical trials, transfer to manufacturing and up to marketing and post-launch support. Our experience allows us to identify challenges in advance and plan accordingly.
about_p_29: Our approach is based on a combination of deep technical expertise, business understanding, and a personal approach to each client. We believe that every project is unique and requires a customized solution. Therefore, we begin every project with a phase of listening and deep understanding of the client's needs, challenges and objectives.
about_p_30: As an expert in obtaining regulatory approvals for design changes in the medical device field, we understand that time is a critical resource. Therefore, we work efficiently and focused, using advanced tools and technologies for project management and documentation. We commit to full transparency and continuous client updates throughout the entire process.
about_p_31: We also believe in knowledge transfer. In every project, we not only perform the work, but also transfer knowledge to the client's team, so they can continue to develop independently. This is part of our true partnership with clients.
about_p_32: We would be happy to talk with you and learn about your challenges and needs. Contact us today for an introductory conversation.

services_h2_6: Interested in Learning More About Our Services?
services_h3_7: Comprehensive and Customized Solutions for Every Regulatory and Technical Challenge
services_p_10: Our process includes comprehensive risk analysis, regulatory strategy planning, professional project management, and close guidance throughout the entire product lifecycle. We understand that each product is unique, so we tailor our approach to the specific needs of each client.
services_p_11: As an expert in obtaining regulatory approvals for design changes in medical devices, we confidently navigate the complex requirements of various health authorities. Whether dealing with minor or significant changes to existing products, we ensure the process is conducted quickly, efficiently, and with a high probability of approval.
services_p_12: Our service includes preliminary assessment of the requested change, determining the required regulatory classification (510k, PMA, CE amendment, etc.), preparing complete documentation, coordinating with regulators, and guidance until final approval is obtained. We work with authorities worldwide and have in-depth knowledge of different requirements.
services_p_13: Leading implementation of PLM documentation and change management systems is one of our core specialties. We understand that an efficient PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) system is the heart of every successful medical device organization, which is why we specialize in selecting, customizing, and implementing these systems.
services_p_14: Our process includes organizational needs analysis, selecting the most suitable system, adapting the system to existing workflows, defining work processes and controls, user training, and post-implementation support. We work with all leading systems in the market and ensure full integration with existing organizational systems.
services_p_15: As an expert in transfer from development to manufacturing in medical device systems, we specialize in creating an efficient bridge between the development stage and commercial manufacturing stage. Our process ensures that the product developed in the lab can transition to large-scale production while maintaining quality, standards compliance, and economic efficiency.
services_p_16: The service includes preparing DMR (Device Master Record) documentation, developing controlled manufacturing processes, validation of equipment and materials, training manufacturing teams, and conducting comprehensive testing and validation. We guide your team at every stage and ensure a smooth transition without delays.
services_p_17: Contact us today for an initial consultation call with no obligation. We'd be happy to learn about your challenges and offer tailored solutions.

our_team_meta_description: Meet the professional team at Noam Med-Defense. Experts in medical device NPI, development to manufacturing transfer, regulation and quality assurance.
services_meta_description: Expert medical device NPI services - managing NPI processes, development to manufacturing transfer, regulatory approvals and PLM systems implementation. Professional solutions for medical device companies.
case_studies_npi_process_p_6: In the medical device world, the transition from development (R&D) to mass production is one of the most critical points in a product's lifecycle. This stage, known as NPI (New Product Introduction), holds many challenges that can determine the fate of the entire project. As an NPI expert in medical devices, I have repeatedly encountered companies with breakthrough technology that failed precisely at the industrialization and transition to serial production stage.
case_studies_npi_process_p_7: In the current case study, we accompanied a medical device company that developed an innovative imaging system. The prototype worked perfectly in the lab, but when they tried to manufacture the first ten units, significant performance deviations were discovered. The main problem was a mismatch between tolerances of components manufactured by hand versus those produced by mass plastic injection. An expert in development-to-production transfer in medical device systems knows how to identify these gaps at the design stage, but here real-time intervention was required.
case_studies_npi_process_p_8: The solution included rebuilding the Device Master Record (DMR) and defining stringent validation processes (IQ, OQ, PQ). We performed an updated risk analysis and implemented engineering changes designed to simplify assembly and reduce dependence on component skill. Leading the implementation of PLM systems for documentation and change management was an integral part of the process, as every change must be documented and approved to meet regulatory requirements (such as ISO 13485 and FDA QSR).
case_studies_npi_process_p_9: One of the main tools we used was Design for Manufacturability (DFM). By working closely with subcontractors, we managed to modify some parts to make them easier and cheaper to manufacture, without compromising clinical functionality. This is the added value of an NPI expert – the ability to see the big picture, from the engineering aspect to the business and regulatory aspects.
case_studies_meta_description: Case studies and success stories in the medical device field. Learn how an NPI expert in medical devices assists in development-to-manufacturing transition, regulatory approvals, and PLM systems implementation.
case_studies_npi_process_h1_1: The Challenge of Development-to-Manufacturing Transition: An NPI Process Case Study
case_studies_npi_process_h2_2: The Gap Between Laboratory and Production Line
case_studies_npi_process_h2_3: Solution Strategy: Validation and Process Control
case_studies_npi_process_p_10: After six months of intensive work, the production line successfully passed all validation tests. The scrap rate dropped from 40% to less than 2%, and production cost per unit was reduced by 15%. The main conclusion from this case is that early integration of an NPI expert in the development process is not a "luxury," but a necessary investment to prevent costly delays down the road. The development-to-production transfer process must be carefully planned, taking into account all regulatory and operational constraints.
accessibility_meta_description: Our Accessibility Statement - Our Commitment to Digital Accessibility
case_studies_npi_process_page_title: NPI Process in Medical Devices - Development to Production Transfer Case Study | Noam Med-Defense
case_studies_plm_implementation_p_6: In the digital age, engineering information management is the backbone of every high-tech company, particularly in the medical device field. The amount of documents, drawings, specifications, and quality tests required for each product is enormous. Without a central Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system, companies find themselves drowning in a sea of conflicting versions, lost emails, and human errors. As an expert in leading PLM documentation and change management system implementations, I see how the transition to a computerized system transforms organizational culture from end to end.
case_studies_plm_implementation_p_7: The client in this case was a rapidly growing startup company that had moved from the development stage to initial sales phases. Engineering information was scattered between network folders, engineers' personal computers, and various ERP systems. The situation created real risk: the procurement department sometimes ordered components according to old drawing versions, leading to financial waste and production delays. Moreover, ahead of an ISO audit, it became clear that some engineering changes were not properly documented and not approved through the required signature chain.
case_studies_plm_implementation_p_8: PLM implementation is not just software installation; it's a process of defining work methodology. We started by mapping existing processes and identifying bottlenecks. We defined the Bill of Materials (BOM) hierarchically and correctly, and established workflows for document approval and Engineering Change Orders (ECO). An NPI expert in medical devices understands how the system must serve not only engineers, but also quality, regulatory, and manufacturing departments.
case_studies_plm_implementation_p_9: The implementation included comprehensive training for different teams and setting precise access permissions. One of the biggest challenges was migrating historical data – filtering relevant information and transferring it to the new system in a clean and verified manner. The PLM system became the organization's 'Single Source of Truth'.
case_studies_regulatory_changes_p_6: Obtaining initial regulatory approval (such as 510(k) or CE approval) is a tremendous achievement for any medical device company. However, the real challenge often begins after that, when the need arises to make changes to the product. These changes can stem from various reasons: supplier changes, component obsolescence, performance improvements, or market feedback. As an expert in obtaining regulatory approvals for design changes in the medical device field, I frequently encounter companies' fear of making necessary changes due to concern about losing existing approval.
case_studies_regulatory_changes_p_7: In this case, we worked with a manufacturer of infusion pumps. One of the critical electronic components in the pump went End of Life, and the company was forced to find an alternative. The available alternative required a change to the printed circuit board (PCB) and a minor software update. The concern was that the change would be considered a 'substantial change' requiring resubmission to the FDA, an expensive and lengthy process. This is where expertise in understanding the nuances of regulation comes into play. Not every change requires resubmission, but every change requires documentation and proof that safety and effectiveness have not been compromised.
case_studies_regulatory_changes_p_8: We led a structured change assessment process (Letter to File). The process included comprehensive risk analysis to ensure the new component does not present new risks or change the existing risk profile. We conducted comprehensive verification testing to compare performance between the old and new components. Leading the implementation of PLM documentation and change management systems was critical in this case, as it allowed us to accurately track the impact of the change on all device subsystems and ensure all relevant documents were updated.
case_studies_regulatory_changes_p_9: The file we prepared included clear engineering justification, comparative test results, and regulatory analysis based on FDA guidance for deciding when to submit a new 510(k) (Deciding When to Submit a 510(k) for a Change to an Existing Device). The reasoned conclusion was that the change does not require a new submission, but only internal documentation.
case_studies_plm_implementation_h1_1: Order from Chaos: PLM System Implementation in a Global Company
case_studies_plm_implementation_h2_2: The Challenge: Islands of Disconnected Information
case_studies_plm_implementation_h2_3: The Implementation Process: More Than Just Software
case_studies_plm_implementation_h2_4: The Result: Efficiency and Peace of Mind
case_studies_plm_implementation_p_10: Today, every product change is managed transparently and in a controlled manner. Engineering Change Order (ECO) processing time was reduced by 40%, and purchasing errors due to incorrect versions were completely eliminated. In the last ISO audit, the auditor praised the level of control in documentation and configuration management. PLM implementation enabled the company to scale up confidently, knowing their information infrastructure is stable and supports the most stringent regulatory requirements.
case_studies_regulatory_changes_h1_1: Navigating Regulation in Complex Design Changes: Mission Impossible?
case_studies_regulatory_changes_h2_2: The Dilemma: Design Change vs. Regulatory Stability
case_studies_regulatory_changes_p_10: Thanks to professional guidance, the company was able to continue manufacturing and marketing the pumps without interruption, saving tens of thousands of dollars that would have been invested in an unnecessary submission, and more importantly – preventing production line stoppage. The case highlights the importance of a regulatory expert who also understands the engineering and operational aspects. The ability to bridge between technical requirements and legal requirements is the key to managing healthy and long-term product life in our regulated industry.
case_studies_npi_process_meta_descriptio: Detailed case study on NPI process in medical devices. How a development-to-production transfer expert helps reduce costs and shorten timelines.
